summary: This document is an email chain from March 2019 regarding the logistics of transferring and uploading digital evidence (a hard drive and discs) related to the US v. Epstein investigation. It involves coordination between an Assistant United States Attorney and other personnel for handling evidence to be stored on a shared DOJ cloud drive.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The email author coordinating the transfer of FBI data on the Epstein case for uploading to a shared drive.

events.title: Evidence Drop-off and Upload
events.description: A hard drive and a number of discs related to the Epstein investigation were dropped off and subsequently uploaded to a specified DOJ cloud directory.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Usa.doj.gov\ cloud\NYS StAndrews\Shared USvEpstein-2018R01618\Investigation 2019.03.06 Hard Drive
keyFacts: Digital evidence (a hard drive and discs) in the Epstein case was being handled and uploaded to a DOJ cloud storage system in March 2019.
The FBI possessed a large amount of data on the Epstein case that needed to be transferred to prosecutors.
The case reference is US v. Epstein-2018R01618, indicating an ongoing federal investigation.
An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York was directly involved in coordinating the evidence logistics.
The document shows procedural steps for evidence handling within the Department of Justice during the investigation.
